channel.title: Statistical Learning on ACE big data
channel.description: Recent content in Statistical Learning on ACE big data

item.title: Statistical Learning
item.description: Definition A closure is a function that makes use of variables defined in outer functions that have previously returned We have to “return” the inner function for this to work We can either call the inner function right away by using an extra () or we can store the result of the function in a variable Closure only exists when an inner function makes use of variables defined from an outer function that has returned.
